intro: Eriocycla stewartii, commonly known as the Stewart's eriocycla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a valuable addition to coastal gardens and ecological restoration projects.
